abstract: New York City police officers begin issuing parking tickets and summonses, and increase arrests, two weeks after beginning severe unsanctioned slowdown; Commissioner William J Bratton had told commanders and union leaders that he expected slowdown to end, and resumption of police activity indicates he still has significant influence over force.
lead_paragraph: After largely ignoring many minor offenses for two weeks, the Police Department’s rank and file began to reverse a severe slowdown that began after two officers were killed.

byline.original: By J. DAVID GOODMAN and AL BAKER

snippet: After largely ignoring many minor offenses for two weeks, the Police Department’s rank and file began to reverse a severe slowdown that began after two officers were killed.

headline.main: Arrests and Summonses Rise in New York City, but Fall Short of Pre-Slowdown Levels
headline.print_headline: Arrests and Summonses Rise in City, but Fall Short of Pre-Slowdown Levels
